meanings.definition: Belonging to or forming the outer surface or structure of something.
meanings.sent1: The external part of the house was painted blue.
meanings.sent2: She admired the external beauty of the flower.
meanings.sent3: The external appearance of the cake made everyone smile.
meanings.sent4: His external calmness hid the storm within.
meanings.sent5: The external glow of the sunset painted the sky in hues of orange and pink.

meanings.definition: Coming or derived from a source outside of a person or thing.
meanings.sent1: The external noise from the street disturbed her concentration.
meanings.sent2: The team considered the external feedback before making a decision.
meanings.sent3: The external delivery of pizza was faster than expected.
meanings.sent4: Her external support helped him through tough times.
meanings.sent5: The external influence of her favorite author shaped her writing style.

meanings.definition: Situated or taking place on the outside.
meanings.sent1: The external gate led to the garden.
meanings.sent2: He preferred the external seats at the stadium for a better view.
meanings.sent3: The external picnic was a fun way to enjoy the sunny day.
meanings.sent4: Her external office was a small cabin by the lake.
meanings.sent5: The external walk along the beach was refreshing and peaceful.
